src:
F√∏rst slo Haaland gjennom. N√• er nok et supertalent fra J√¶ren klar for landslaget
Elisabeth Terland vokste opp i samme milj√∏ som Erling Braut Haaland. Pappa Espen la tidlig en klar plan for √• n√• toppen.
07 Nov 2019, 05:10 by Odd Inge Aas
STAVANGER: ‚Äì Det er J√¶ren, vettu.
Elisabeth Terland smiler i novembersolen p√• Vikings storstue i J√•ttav√•gen mellom Stavanger og Sandnes. Kommentaren er ikke svar p√• et sp√∏rsm√•l om det overraskende, milde s√∏rvestlandsv√¶ret, iallfall √•rstiden tatt i betraktning. Temaet er derimot Aftenpostens nylige k√•ring av nasjonens st√∏rste fotballtalenter, hvor Terland havnet helt √∏verst blant jentene.
I toppen tronet hun og Erling Braut Haaland, begge oppfostret og herdet i sidevind og regn tre-fire mil s√∏r for stadionet hvor Norge fredag m√∏ter Nord-Irland i EM-kvalifiseringen.
2000-modellen Haaland debuterte p√• A-landslaget tidligere i h√∏st og er p√• sensasjonelt vis h√∏stens toppscorer i mennenes Champions League.
N√• er 2001-modellen Terland tatt ut i det aller beste landslagsselskapet for f√∏rste gang. Hun har tydeligvis et poeng med dette med J√¶ren, men hvorfor akkurat den gr√∏nne kyststripen med hav og hei, steingjerder og bondeg√•rder tett i tett?

Fakta: Elisabeth Terland
F√∏dt: 28.6.2001
Klubber: N√¶rb√∏, Bryne, Klepp
Har spilt 40 kamper for aldersbestemte landslag. Er med i A-landslagstroppen for f√∏rste gang og kan f√• debuten mot Nord-Irland p√• fredag.
Meritter: S√∏lv i Toppserien og gull i junior-NM med Klepp.

Terlands enkleste forklaring er at mye handler om mange fotballivrige j√¶rbuer i hennes generasjon. Som 13-√•ring byttet hun ut barndomsklubben N√¶rb√∏ med Bryne og kom inn i √•rsklassen under Haaland.
Aftenposten har tidligere skrevet om sistnevntes barndomslag, hvor hele fem spillere fikk ungdomslandskamper for Norge. Terland ble en del av det samme milj√∏et.
‚Äì Jeg har hele tiden spilt med gutter, og det tror jeg har hatt stor betydning for meg og utviklingen min. Guttene var gode, og jeg hadde alltid noe √• m√•le meg opp mot.

Stor k√•ring: Her er de ti st√∏rste fotballtalentene i Norge



F√∏rste reis med landslaget.üì∑ Fredrik Refvem

Fikk ikke v√¶re i komfortsonen
Terland har ved flere anledninger trukket frem pappa Espen som helt sentral utviklingen hennes. Han sitter p√• en traktor p√• J√¶ren Gartneri da Aftenposten ringer, men kombinerer gjerne landbruksvirksomheten med en prat om datterens vei mot fotballtoppen.
Det er ikke tilfeldig at datteren spilte med gutter. Filosofien deres var √• bytte til et h√∏yere niv√• den dagen hun var best p√• et lag.
‚Äì Jeg trente henne frem til hun var 13 √•r, og hun hadde ingenting p√• et jentelag √• gj√∏re. Da ble det bare 15‚Äì0, og hun scoret 12 av m√•lene. Jeg lette etter alternativer der hun ikke var best og ikke havnet i komfortsonen, sier trenerpappaen.

Fakta: Norge i EM-kvalifiseringen

Tabell:

1. Norge 3 (3‚Äì0‚Äì0) (+25) 9 poeng
2. Wales 3 (2‚Äì1‚Äì0) (+7) 7 poeng
3. Hviterussland 3 (1‚Äì0‚Äì2) (-1) 3 poeng
4. Nord-Irland 2 (0‚Äì1‚Äì1) (-6) 1 poeng
5. F√¶r√∏yene 3 (0‚Äì0‚Äì3) (-25) 0 poeng
Neste kamper: Fredag: Nord-Irland (hjemme), 14. april: Wales (borte), 5. juni: F√¶r√∏yene (hjemme)

Da hun i starten av ungdoms√•rene dro til Bryne, kom hun til en klubb hvor de har for vane √• gi gode jenter muligheten p√• guttelag. S√∏strene Tuva og Hege Hansen er gode eksempler. F√∏rstnevnte (22) er ogs√• med landslaget denne uken, mens stores√∏steren var i den norske VM-troppen i 2015.
Andrea Nordheim (20) er et annet tilfelle. Stortalentet spilte p√• guttelaget til Haaland og har 70 aldersbestemte landskamper for Norge.

Den norske 19-√•ringen imponerer en hel fotballverden. Et helt spesielt milj√∏ p√• J√¶ren kan forklare suksessen



Elisabeth Terland er sp√•dd en stor fotballfremtid. Her blir hun intervjuet med landslagets st√∏rste stjerne, Caroline Graham Hansen.üì∑ Fredrik Refvem

Likeverdig p√• guttelagene
Pappa Terland har trent barna sine i b√•de fotball og h√•ndball. Da slapp de √• bli dratt mellom de to idrettene og kunne velge selv hva de ville satse p√•.
Noen regler har han imidlertid hatt.
‚Äì Folk trodde jo at hun ikke gjorde annet enn √• trene, og at jeg var en gal far som sto p√• sidelinjen og skrek. Det har imidlertid alltid v√¶rt obligatorisk med minst √©n fridag i uken. Hun har heller aldri f√•tt lov til √• trene dobbelt, alts√• b√•de fotball og h√•ndball samme dag. Da m√•tte hun velge, sier han.
Treneren mener lagene har v√¶rt preget av treningsglede og -iver. Barna m√• skj√∏nne at hvis de vil bli gode, s√• m√• de trene.


Terland er en av n√∏kkelspillerne for Klepp.üì∑ Kristian Jacobsen

N√¶rb√∏ har en sterk idrettstradisjon. Herrelaget i h√•ndball spiller for tiden i eliteserien. Terland senior peker p√• en sterk kultur, hvor det legges vekt p√• at alt skal v√¶re lystbetont. Toppen har alltid spilt p√• lag med bredden.
‚Äì Vi behandler alle likt, s√• vil de som skal ta steget gj√∏re det, sier han.
Datteren har hele tiden hatt guttelagstrenere som har lagt vekt p√• at spillergruppen skal akseptere henne som en likeverdig del av laget.
F√∏r 2017-sesongen dro Terland videre til J√¶rens beste kvinnelag. 15 √•r gammel debuterte hun p√• det √∏verste niv√•et i Norge.
‚Äì Det var et veldig godt milj√∏ i Bryne. S√• kom det til et punkt hvor jeg m√•tte til Klepp og spille med jenter, siden guttene ble litt store, sier hun.

Stort Graham Hansen-intervju: ¬´Hvis alle snakker litt hele tiden, blir det til slutt en stor stemme det er vanskelig √• ignorere¬ª



Elisabeth Terland kan f√• landslagsdebuten p√• stadion til Viking.üì∑ Fredrik Refvem

Legger seg klokken ni
N√• er Terland et av talentene landslagsledelsen har pekt ut med tanke p√• EM om to √•r. Turneringen i England er det neste store m√•let for laget.
‚Äì Vi har fulgt Elisabeth en tid. Problemet har v√¶rt for mange skadeavbrekk, men n√• har hun hatt kontinuitet over tid og spilt bra p√• J19-landslaget og for Klepp. Dette var en god mulighet √• ta med en av dem vi mener har st√∏rst potensial til √• etablere seg p√• laget, b√•de p√• kort og lang sikt, sier trener Martin Sj√∂gren.
P√• landslagssamlingen kan Terland unne seg litt mer s√∏vn p√• morgenkvisten enn i hverdagen, for her er frokosten senere enn hjemme p√• N√¶rb√∏.
Vanligvis ringer vekkerklokken rundt 06.00. Timeplanen er lik nesten hver dag.
Frokost ‚Äì skole ‚Äì rett p√• trening ‚Äì komme seg hjem ‚Äì spise ‚Äì s√• legge seg for √• sove i nitiden. Enkelte vil nok definere det som et ganske ensformig liv. Hun liker det, selv om det av og til er t√∏ft. Prioriteringen er enkel og klar.
‚Äì Fotball har hele tiden v√¶rt livet. Det er livet, sier 18-√•ringen.
text:
First, Haaland broke through. Now another super talent from J√¶ren is ready for the national team
Elisabeth Terland grew up in the same environment as Erling Braut Haaland. Dad Espen made a clear plan early to reach the top.
07 Nov 2019, 05:10 by Odd Inge Aas
STAVANGER: - It's J√¶ren, vettu.
Elisabeth Terland smiles in the November sun at Viking's main living room in J√•ttav√•gen between Stavanger and Sandnes. The comment is not an answer to a question about the surprisingly mild southwest weather, at least considering the season. The theme, on the other hand, is Aftenposten's recent award of the nation's greatest football talents, where Terland ended up at the top among the girls.
At the top, she and Erling Braut Haaland, both raised and hardened in side winds and rained three to four miles south of the stadium where Norway meets Northern Ireland in the European Championship qualifiers on Friday.
The 2000 model Haaland debuted at the national team earlier this fall and is sensationally the top scorer of the men's Champions League.
Now the 2001 model Terland has been selected in the very best national team for the first time. She obviously has a point with this with J√¶ren, but why exactly the green coastal strip of sea and hay, stone fences and farmhouses close in close?

Facts: Elisabeth Terland
Born: 28.6.2001
Clubs: N√¶rb√∏, Bryne, Klepp
Has played 40 matches for age-specific national teams. Joins the A-squad for the first time and can make his debut against Northern Ireland on Friday.
Merits: Silver in the Toppserier and gold in the junior NM with Klepp.

Terland's simplest explanation is that a lot is about many football-loving jerks in her generation. As a 13-year-old she exchanged the childhood club N√¶rb√∏ with Bryne and entered the year class under Haaland.
Aftenposten has previously written about the latter's childhood team, where as many as five players received youth national matches for Norway. Terland became part of the same environment.
- I've been playing with boys all the time, and I think that has had a big impact on me and my development. The boys were good and I always had something to measure up to.

Big honors: Here are the ten biggest football talents in Norway



First trip with the national team.üì∑ Fredrik Refvem

Didn't get in the comfort zone
Terland has on several occasions highlighted Dad Espen as her central development. He sits on a tractor at J√¶ren Gartneri when Aftenposten calls, but he often combines agricultural activities with a talk about his daughter's way to the football peak.
It is no coincidence that the daughter played with boys. Their philosophy was to switch to a higher level the day she was best on a team.
- I trained her until she was 13, and she had nothing on a girls team to do. Then it was only 15-0, and she scored 12 of the goals. I was looking for alternatives where she wasn't the best and didn't end up in the comfort zone, says the trainer dad.

Facts: Norway in the European Championship qualification

Table:

1. Norway 3 (3‚Äì0‚Äì0) (+25) 9 points
2. Wales 3 (2‚Äì1‚Äì0) (+7) 7 points
3. Belarus 3 (1‚Äì0‚Äì2) (-1) 3 points
4. Northern Ireland 2 (0-1-1) (-6) 1 point
5. The Faroe Islands 3 (0‚Äì0‚Äì3) (‚Äì25) 0 points
Next matches: Friday: Northern Ireland (home), 14 April: Wales (away), 5 June: Faroe Islands (home)

When she went to Bryne at the beginning of her teens, she came to a club where they have the habit of giving good girls the opportunity on boys' teams. The sisters Tuva and Hege Hansen are good examples. The former (22) is also with the national team this week, while the big sister was in the Norwegian World Cup squad in 2015.
Andrea Nordheim (20) is another case. The big talent played on the boys team for Haaland and has 70 age-specific national matches for Norway.

The Norwegian 19-year-old impresses an entire football world. A very special environment at J√¶ren can explain the success



Elisabeth Terland is predicting a big football future. Here she is interviewed by the national team's biggest star, Caroline Graham Hansen.üì∑ Fredrik Refvem

Equal to the boys teams
Dad Terland has trained his children in both football and handball. Then they didn't have to be dragged between the two sports and could choose for themselves what they wanted to bet on.
However, he has had some rules.
- People thought she was doing nothing but exercising, and that I was a crazy father standing on the sidelines screaming. However, it has always been mandatory with at least one day off per week. She has also never been allowed to work out twice, ie both football and handball on the same day. Then she had to choose, he says.
The coach believes the teams have been characterized by training joy and zeal. The children must realize that if they want to be good, then they must exercise.


Terland is one of the key players for Klepp.üì∑ Kristian Jacobsen

N√¶rb√∏ has a strong sports tradition. The men's handball team is currently playing in the elite series. Terland senior points to a strong culture, where it is emphasized that everything should be fun. The top has always played in teams with the width.
- We treat everyone equally, so those who want to take the step will do so, he says.
The daughter has always had boy team coaches who have emphasized that the player group should accept her as an equal part of the team.
Before the 2017 season Terland went on to J√¶ren's best women's team. At the age of 15, she made her debut at the top level in Norway.
- It was a very good environment in Bryne. Then it came to a point where I had to go to Klepp and play with girls, since the boys got a little big, she says.

Great Graham Hansen Interview: "If everyone talks a bit all the time, eventually it becomes a big voice that's hard to ignore"



Elisabeth Terland can make the national team debut at the Viking stadium.üì∑ Fredrik Refvem

Going to bed at nine o'clock
Now Terland is one of the talents the national team management has pointed out for the European Championships in two years. The tournament in England is the next big goal for the team.
- We've been following Elisabeth for a while. The problem has been too many injury breaks, but now she has had continuity over time and played well at the J19 national team and for Klepp. This was a great opportunity to bring one of those we believe has the most potential to establish on the team, both in the short and long term, says coach Martin Sj√∂gren.
At the national team gathering Terland can indulge in a little more sleep in the morning twig than in everyday life, because here the breakfast is later than home at N√¶rb√∏.
Usually the alarm clock rings around 6am. The schedule is the same almost every day.
Breakfast - school - right on exercise - get home - eat - so go to bed for the last minute. Some will probably define it as a pretty monotonous life. She likes it, though sometimes it's tough. The priority is simple and clear.
- Football has always been life. That's life, says the 18-year-old.
